column4: I cannot for the life of me get ssh functioning properly anymore. It worked fine under edgy. I read the feisty how to, and it's still not working. Port 22 is forwarded properly in my router. I can't connect on my lan, or externally, through putty on windows. I keep getting connection timed out errors. sshd is definitely running,
Do sudo iptables -vL && sudo iptables -nVL and tell me if there is anything listed under OUTPUT, FORWARD, INPUT, etc.
You might have installed a firewall (iptables) script by mistake
dpkg
Nope, all blank
Go on the Ubuntu box and do ssh 127.0.0.1, see it that works
Yeah I can ssh to localhost
Check your sshd.conf file
thanks, now I know the problem isn't on here. Should've thought of that
/etc/sshd.conf?
/etc/ssh/sshd_config on Ubuntu
thanks
I found Ubuntu had good comments, and I seem to remember sshd support outside localhost might have been turned off, depending on which sshd daemon you are using
yeah, it's nicely written. Thanks a lot for the pointer, I'll get back to you if I figure out what's b0rkd
Check the ListenAddress to start out with maybe
yeah, that's blank, so I don't know if I can just add *.*.*.* to it or if I need to define a range or specific ip or what.
Mine is commented out, so that should be fine
Default is to listen to all addresses
yeah, still getting connection timed out on the lan, and No Route To Host when I try to come in remotely now
You can ping your Ubuntu box from within the lan, right?
I could until just now :/

well now my ubuntu box isn't responding to pings from my windows box, but my windows box is responding to pings from my ubuntu box, so I'm assuming that the problem is actually with my windows box or my router, rather than with my ssh setup
